website_summaries.verdict: Simple manual winch offered at a good price point that will handle average-sized jobs nicely.
pros: Uses a zinc-plated finish to resist corrosion, even when being used in wet conditions
Popular model because of its low price and easy-to-use design
Will deliver a smooth level of cranking ability to ensure you can lift your gear safely
cons: Limited to 600 pounds of lifting capacity
Only works as a one-way ratcheting winch

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Not For A Trailer
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used these on a trailer, and frankly, I wouldn't use these on my trailer because of their low weight capacity. However, these work great for cranking things up in garages. I have used these with paracord, and they work great for lighter loads.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce Lilholt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Needed a winch to raise/lower a ham radio mast in my backyard. Didn't do the math but estimated this was the right size to handle at least 50' of my 3/16" vinyl coated steel cable, and it did. Mounted it to a 4x4" post and voila! Does exactly what I need it to do. Good quality, solid brakes and ratcheting mechanism. Will definitely buy from again if the need arises!
customer_reviews.author: Maker Mac

customer_reviews.title: Best $18 I ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: I've been fighting with my 24 super-gourd Martin house for years. The flimsy crank that cane with the pole always was a struggle to use. I wanted to replace it but the purple marten org wanted like $50 or more for the same flimsy crank. .. hey I know it's also to help the org... but come 'on... I wondered if this one would be strong enough because some times the pictures are misleading. Fear not! If anything it is more sturdy than the picture shows. Now it is a simple pleasure to crank my 24 super gourd colony up and down the pole... with out fear it may crash on my head!
customer_reviews.author: CGH

customer_reviews.title: Good winch
customer_reviews.text: These are great, heavy-duty winches. They do the job well. The only think I find wrong...and the only reason they don't get 5 stars, is because they take forever to crank any appreciable length of cable or rope. My application is to crank my bike to the ceiling of my garage...and it takes almost 200 cranks to get the bike to the ceiling...which is only about 12 feet. That's too long.
customer_reviews.author: popskirk

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my bowstring making table and bow tuning station. Works perfectly!!! Note to potential buyers... this is a one way ratcheting winch, will not ratchet in the opposite direction and changing the handle and components to the other side while possible would be difficult and additional holes would need to be drilled. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: BrycenMTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Maybe better with wire of 1/ 4 in  or finer
customer_reviews.text: Because the center axle is too small to wrap the wire i'm using around the wire kind of bends to the point the cable unravels. My wire is 3/8 in but it might be better on finer wire, The thing works okay heavy wire just gets bent at the beginning of the length for the first couple of wraps. Seems a poor design oversight but it spins and holds. Seems heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: it works great. Exposed to the elements it does not rust ...
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be solidly built, though I'm not sure how well it would hold up after repeated use at or near the weight capacity. If you plan to use this for raising or lowering objects 400+ lbs, I'd go for a high rated winch just to be safe. For my use (raising and lowering a hops vine trellis not exceeding 100 lbs), it works great. Exposed to the elements it does not rust at all. You really can't beat this for the price. Edit: after 2 years of continuous exposure outside to the elements, this still looks like the day I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Hero

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does what it needs to do and holds the load. It does not reverse at all so be aware.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Using mine for a odd purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Employed my wench in the attic of my home to open and close a huge triangular vent on one end of the house. In very cold winter I wanted to be able to close the vent and keep some warm air in and colder air out. This does the trick for this 10 foot wide & 4 foot tall vent.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: This is a great winch, but its not at all reversible
customer_reviews.text: This is a great winch, but its not at all reversible. Even though that's not in the description, every winch I see can be mounted reversed if you disassemble and reassemble. Other than that, this is a quality piece.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice hoist
customer_reviews.text: The winch looked heavy duty and simple to operate appearing a lot stronger than other winches. Unfortunately I couldn't use it in my application as there was not enough wall clearance to mount it. The shipment was quick and the return was likewise quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: awesome winch for the money
customer_reviews.text: works awesome for what I got it for. being older and handicapped, I use it for getting deer up into the back of my truck. I have a pulley system set up from the front of the bed and it takes the hardest load off of me. I also use a slide board in conjunction with the winch. wish I had done this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: jerry cox

customer_reviews.title: worked for us.
customer_reviews.text: Actually we purchased these to handle Purple Martin houses .My husband and his sister are both pleased with the function.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Which winch?  This great winch!
customer_reviews.text: Great winch. Easy to install (my 6 yr old screwed it on). Great load capability (used to lift a home-made metal sandbox cover). Strong, but easy to use release (released the clicking mechanism and lowered the cover without intervention, just mounted out of the way so no danger from the spinning handle). Was able to use my preferred rope. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Perfetto

customer_reviews.title: Great for hanging deer feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make a hanging deer feeder with 3/16 steel cable. I pushed the cable through the spool and it even had a place to easily anchor it. It does not ratchet down but it was not an issue for my use, even bringing down a 50 lb deer feeder. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: GX1859

customer_reviews.title: smooth operation
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth for a home project. It would roll 40ft of 1/4 cable onto the reel. I use the socket and drill instead of the hand crank. It's perfectly doable.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Smooth working and good value.
customer_reviews.text: I used these to lift a net on a softball field, they got the net up so the foul balls didn't hit the neighboring house.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Great for a feeder winch!
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a winch for a hanging feeder. It makes it easier to fill and keep the pigs from emptying it by rubbing on the post. It also makes it harder for the raccoons to get to it and try to empty it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cash

customer_reviews.title: Note Drum Size
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my application on an Alaskan saw mill. The exterior metal case is steel but can still be drilled through for mounting bolts without extreme difficulty but keep in mind it is steel. The drum size is a about 3/4 an inch so using thick steel cable could be an issue trying to wind a new cable around the drum without heavy tension. My application calls for para-cord where the 600lb limit will never be reached.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 of these for my 65’ cabled batting cage. They are so easy my 9 yr old son can tighten the cage and get his reps in without any help.
customer_reviews.author: TheKEG

customer_reviews.title: Winch for a bird feeder line
customer_reviews.text: I ran 550 cord 10 ft up between 2 trees. The plan was to suspend 5 bird feeders and keep bear, deer, and squirrels away. This winch made it possible for my wife to raise the line. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: tech

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well built, no complaints!
customer_reviews.text: It works, its easy to turn, and a drill with a socket on the crank nut will wind it for you. Release is easy to throw, and the crank seems fluid and well made. Solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harbin

customer_reviews.title: Did exactly what I wanted it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to assist me in hooking up the tensioner spring on my ZTR mower. I screwed it to the floor of my shed and ran a 1⁄8" cable from the hook on the spring to the reel of the winch. A few clicks of the winch, a slight adjustment in alignment, and the job was done! It was like having a third hand and made the job, not only safe, but fast and easy. Now, an even smaller one mounted on the deck of ones mower for the same purpose would be even better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Hand crank
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, we are using it to pull up ancore, easy crank and lock
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy deer.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Heavy duty and works great! Works perfect for raising and lowering my deer feeder suspended from a tree branch.
customer_reviews.author: Big E

customer_reviews.title: great little winch for the money.
customer_reviews.text: great little winch for the money. I have more than one of these... I use one for my bow draw-board, one for my trailer to help me load large object, and one for my deer cleaning station to hoist up critters. DOES NOT COME WITH ROPE/LINE!!! Order some "550 cord" to go with it ($3-$7)... double it over and tie it on.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Currently used to hold my 80lb canoe above my car
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased a 2k lbs winch from harbor freight tools. Once that snapped under the force of 60lbs, i went to amazon and found this amazing piece of equipment. I couldnt be happier with the performance. The locking lever was a definite plus as well since I did intend on using it to hoist a canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: dont hate dont love it either but good price
customer_reviews.text: worked but be aware it does NOT come with the cross bolt that holds the tow strap. i was able to tear apart my old and make it work.
customer_reviews.author: gdgardner

customer_reviews.title: Not really for wire rope
customer_reviews.text: This winch is probably great for natural or nylon ropes, but the hub is only about a 1/2" in diameter. This causes a pretty large strength reduction for the 1/4" wire rope I used with it. Reese indicates that a different winch (with a 1.75" hub) should be used used for wire rope in the instructions. Search the internet to find advice on how much the 1/2" hub radius will reduce the strength of your wire-rope. The ratchet only acts in one direction. It is still a good winch for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jared J. Johansen

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, gives great mechanical advantage at a low price. I used it with paracord and some pulleys to hang a canoe in my garage. No issues. Works great. Only limitation is that it does not ratchet out (only in). This is as advertised but I may have been better off purchasing one with a two way ratchet.
customer_reviews.author: Parabellum

customer_reviews.title: Lift winch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this winch as the lift mechanism for my one man keg lifter. A 1/2 barrel of beer weighs approximately 160 pounds and with the lift that I build one person can easily lift the keg into a top load keg-o-rader. This lift works exceptionally well lifting up and is very smooth and easy to control going down. Perfect for the application.
customer_reviews.author: Ygnacio T. Toulon

customer_reviews.title: Bike Hoist Wench.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my garage to allow my wife to hoist up her bike toward the ceiling and out of the way. Now she can easily raise and lower her bike whenever she wants to ride. Works well. Installed easily. Nice compact design. JoeM.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Mrusko

customer_reviews.title: Excellent winch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the winch for use on a large BBQ grill. The grill weight is approximately 200# and difficult to raise with the 20" manual wheel. I replaced the manual wheel with a 9" cable spool and attached the cable to the winch. A 90# weakling can raise the grill now. The winch is well built, and easily handles the rated load.
customer_reviews.author: lastsixmilid

customer_reviews.title: Great value, price and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent winch for the price point and my purpose of replacing one on a deer hoist. Well built and functions smoothly. Instructions are clear. All in all, a great buy on a light duty winch.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: A very good utility winch
customer_reviews.text: Served my need perfectly. Did not know a priori that the ratchet was one way only, but it was still OK. I liked the use of a nylon stop-nut for the handle. Instructions for attaching the ropes were helpful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rogers Woolston

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and fair
customer_reviews.text: Fit my needs very well. I use these to raise and lower wine tank lids in our winery. Good quality and fair price
customer_reviews.author: Acampoman

customer_reviews.title: Nice winch for the money. Works well for PWC trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Bolted right up to my older load rite pic trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Good price good quality
customer_reviews.text: Just using this to crank bicycles up and down in a pole barn on a pulley system. Good smooth cranking with good gear ratio. Fits my needs just fine. Would recommend for light uses.
customer_reviews.author: Paulsbud

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. I used for a canoe lift but would be good for small boat.
customer_reviews.text: Good price and well built. Instructions are thorough and seems like quality material. Would be great for a little boat but I used this for a canoe lift I built under he pier.
customer_reviews.author: Douglasson!

customer_reviews.title: great drill press lifter
customer_reviews.text: I mounted mine on back of Powermatic floor mounted drill press. Moving the table up and down the column has always been a chore that you resist whenever possible. I set this up with a pulley at the top and made a bracket at the table and now I can crank it up or let it down with one hand. Wish I had done it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: phil morse

customer_reviews.title: ... themselves up with the pulley set up it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Built a tree house and made a elevator so the kids could pull themselves up with the pulley set up it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.G

customer_reviews.title: Very durable!!
customer_reviews.text: Made a pulley system for lifting deer into my side by side. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lisk

customer_reviews.title: Good Winch for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure of the 600 lb capacity claim, but this is a good quality light-duty winch for the money. It does the job I purchased it for flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: JWall00

customer_reviews.title: this works perfect for what ii wanted it for
customer_reviews.text: this works perfect for what ii wanted it for. i use to role up a reinforced plastic over our trellis over a 32' long walkway so i don,t have to clean the leaves & snow off the sidewalks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Little Winch that Could!
customer_reviews.text: This little winch is super! It's just what I needed to hoist my kayak above my car. You need at least 9" of clearance for the handle to turn. I was lucky enough to find a bracket that gave me 10" of clearance. I used three 5/16" x 3" lags to secure it to my garage wall.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Dumas

customer_reviews.title: Anchors away
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lighter weight winch to raise and lower my pontoon anchor. It works great, although I had to be creative and install it sideways to fit between the boat rails. It also stores the line neatly. It is so much easier to raise and lower the anchor with this easy crank winch.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Good boat wench
customer_reviews.text: Boat for husbands boat remodel. He has purchased one prior so very happy with this one
customer_reviews.author: Newman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to crank-up garage storage. Really happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my garage to lift a Yakima skybox up out of the way using a couple pulleys and rings and such. It works great. I am really happy with it. Reasonably priced, solid, easy to use. Awesome for my application.
customer_reviews.author: 1GoodDog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect..
customer_reviews.text: Perfect...I bought this for skinning Florida deer and 3/8 rope is good enough..will hold 600 pounds.Oil the sleeves and grease the gears and it's wonderful.Awesome price
customer_reviews.author: Chuck 7

customer_reviews.title: this was great quality compared to the one that came on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one on a deer hoist I bought, this was great quality compared to the one that came on the hoist. Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L Webb

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Does what it was designed for
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Does what it was designed for. Used it in a chainsaw mill setup. Definitely helps.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good price and works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to build a bow draw board. for the price it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Good to go
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my project (the hoisting & lowering of a heavy bag).
customer_reviews.author: King Kong

customer_reviews.title: Not great if using "straps" but good otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Good but this model is not really made for "straps". It does not include the bar to retain a strap at the center drum. I made it work though. Other than that seems good for the money
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Great wench for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice wench for my needs, worked great for my lawnmower trailer, use it all the time.great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tex Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Incredible For the bucks!
customer_reviews.text: I found no downside for this purchase. It's well made and everything disassembles. And get this...MADE IN USA. How many things can you say that about!? I used mine to raise and lower a large pole mounted birdfeeder. This unit was the compact size I was looking for. I will say it handles my feeder like it's not even there and I have it strung with 3/32" wire rope. Great winch.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for jeep tops !
customer_reviews.text: Used this to crank the harness for my jeep top. Very sturdy and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT M.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked for two launches and broke. I have a small 17’ aluminum boat and i only used to pull the last couple feet to trailer. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Allan Ball

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Everything is made from steel parts. I use this to hoist my Wrangler hard top and it works like a charm, so I haven't tested more than 200 pounds with it. Just for anyone's reference, the ratcheting is loud as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Collins

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to raise an lower a hinged porch window.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Mason

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit my application but that was my fault.Anybody want a bargain wench?
customer_reviews.author: Ron J

customer_reviews.title: The price is right. Used for cranking up deer ...
customer_reviews.text: The price is right. Used for cranking up deer feeders. Have these on four feeders now. Reese Towpower 74337 600 Pound Capacity Winch ...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used mine to raise and lower a shade sail ...
customer_reviews.text: I used mine to raise and lower a shade sail system in my yard. Holds up to some serious tension and no problems over the last couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie P.

customer_reviews.title: I would have liked it to have a catch locking it when you ...
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked it to have a catch locking it when you let the line out, but that was not in the description, so I knew what I was getting for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly product description matched item as delivered no issues or false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart H Caudill

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a boat trailer winch!
customer_reviews.text: Nice winch....I'm just using mine on a 12ft boat trailer, but I think it'd work for up to a 16foot boat no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Durable and good deal for the $$
customer_reviews.text: I've yet to install it for my paddle boat, but, having used these winches before, I know they strong and durable and a good deal for the money. Fast shipper.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkshaw

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. I use it to hoist up ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected . I use it to hoist up deer in my shop .
customer_reviews.author: munrus71

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: couldn't find everything I needed locally so ordered it all online. Good product at a good price Just what I needed for making a deer skinning rack.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE H.

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: good quality, and does the trick! Make sure you have the bolts you need as this kit doesn't come with any bolts. I added a cable to this and it made a very nice heavy duty winch for my boat!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Learn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and adequate for my use of raising a feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B Gingras

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well built and simple design.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome unit. Much more solid than I expected it to be, easy to mount to my pole with a u-bolt, and easy to attach my rope to it. The only thing I'm not sure of is how it will handle the weather. I'm planing on leaving it outside year round.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: very well built
customer_reviews.text: Better than I thought, used it to raise and lower my home built sawmill head .Great value AND MADE IN USA.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I needed. I use two ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. I use two of these so my daughters can winch up our kayaks and surf boards to the roof of our garage.
customer_reviews.author: P. Laidlaw

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Working great after the first summer of use in a davit hoisting a lightweight dinghy out of and into the water.
customer_reviews.author: Gale Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Topless Inspirations
customer_reviews.text: Crankin dude. Takin tops off bro. JK, goin up and down the road with it off or on.. thanks to this awesome tool.
customer_reviews.author: inthecorn

customer_reviews.title: Works as described!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be holding up well after 9 months, roughly, of use. Not great, but does the job that I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with strap or cable but the straps and cables are readily available. Works well on the deer hoists that I build in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: ZBix

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Love the strength of this winch, used it for a playground to hang a rope for kids to play on, has not rusted yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sam MT

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Good little cheap winch, used it on a tripod feeder. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie in BC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good winch just the way i want,it arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly! It is very well made, and I expect it to last a long time. I would recommend this company.
customer_reviews.author: PatCliffJ

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The spool could be a little larger so that the rope doesn't come off while using it. Overall it does well.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: Holding my pickup cover overhead and lowers into place perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lykins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice winch delivered on time, and met expectations as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: ken janke

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed in my pole barn to ratnst up my pully system to the rafters. Works fantastic
customer_reviews.author: R. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Catapult Winch
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up to use on a torsion catapult we built. Very well made and holds up to the weather.
customer_reviews.author: TJC

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cheap, locking winch. This is it. So far works well. I would buy again, want I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: OZ

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It has served my purpose very well. Very handy sturdy winch and does the job very well for the purpose I"m using it for. Very reasonably priced and free shipping couldn't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Swoboda

customer_reviews.title: No more old cranks!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to repair an umbrella that was unusable with the original crank. works rather well.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: nice winch
customer_reviews.text: A bit smaller than was expected but very nice. Feels like it will last a long time. Great price for this winch. Would buy another in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: a little small but good enough for what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Good basic small hand-winch.
customer_reviews.text: Has clamp hardware for cable-end (cable not included.) Solid, simple, works well.
customer_reviews.author: Harold T. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, I used it to pull a pontoon boat up into the rafters of my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what it said it was and what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I used the Reese Towpower 74337 to lift the cargo cover to my full size Ford 150 pick-up. I mounted the winch in the ceiling to one of the 2 x 8 rafters and used 600 lb. twisted nylon rope to lift it with a hook on all four sides. it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mounts easily. Seems durable
customer_reviews.text: Mounts easily. Seems durable. The only negative is there is no mounting hardware for the winch included. Nor is there a pin provided to secure the winch/rope to the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than I needed but a great size
customer_reviews.text: This winch was bought as part of a simple build. I used it to make a lift in the shed for a kids battery powered ride on truck. A pulley, winch, rope, steel ring, carabiners, and a plywood base get it up into the rafters leaving room for the lawn tractor. The winch is very easy to operate and install, just make sure you have clearance for the handle to turn. I mounted it to a 2x4 wall and had to pack it out with a piece of 2x4 to give me enough depth to not scrape my fingers on the wall when turning.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence A. Di Giovanne

customer_reviews.title: Very well made!!
customer_reviews.text: I am using them to help raise and lower our projection screens. They are very smooth and can carry a huge load.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Harvey Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Reese Towpower Winch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on our deer cleaning station at the farm. Easy assembly and mounting. Makes for easy work in lifting with one handed cranking.
customer_reviews.author: David

product_meta.title: Reese Towpower 74337 600 Pound Capacity Winch
product_meta.description: 600 pound capacity with a 3.1:1 ratio this winch is zinc plated for exceptional corrosion resistance. Gears are constructed of high carbon SAE 1050 steel to resist corrosion and last longer. Full-length drum bushing and oil impregnated shaft bushings minimize maintenance. Comfort grip handle makes cranking easier. Designed to be used with 36’ x 1/4” rope or a 15’ x 2” strap.
feature_bullets: Includes comfort grip handle for a positive hold while cranking
Zinc-plated finish for superior corrosion resistance
Full-length drum bushing and oil impregnated shaft bushings minimize maintenance
High carbon steel gears to resist wear and last longer
